description.hltext_display: RA’s Rachal headlines Class 2A All-State squad
description.content: LObservateurSt. John Parish saw seven players selected to the Class 2A All-State football team including the classifications very best offensive threat.The Louisiana Sports Writers Association voted Riverside quarterback Darnell Rachal as this seasons Outstanding Player on offense, besting a number of fellow prolific producers to nail down the honor. Riverside’s Darnell Rachal received a high honor this week when he was name Class 2A’s Outstanding Player for 2010. Rachal is joined on the team by teammate Dale Martin, an offensive tackle, and five St. Charles Comets Marcus Hall, Harley Scioneaux, Brady Hitt, LaJaylin Smith and Jared Keating.RA defensive lineman Andrew Vicknair was named honorable mention.Rachal directed the most prolific offense in Riverside history, a squad that averaged 41.5 points per game. The Rebels scored 40 points or more in 10 of their 13 games. Rachal himself was the definition of a dual threat, hurting defenses with his arm and his legs. Passing, he tallied 1,587 yards and 15 touchdowns to go with four interceptions. Running the ball out of the Rebels spread attack, he piled up 1,789 yards and 33 touchdowns, giving him 48 total over the course of the season.I was so excited (to hear the news), said Rachal, a senior. I put a lot of hard work into this and I guess it shows that it pays off.Rachal said that he felt Riverside had a chance to have a big season based on the surrounding talent coming back.We had a lot of seniors on the team and had a lot of guys around me to make it possible, he said. The offensive line opened holes and there were a lot of guys around me to command attention and make plays.Riverside coach Mickey Roussel said he likewise expected Rachal, and the Rebel offense, to have a big year.When he came in under Tim (Taffi), he got here during the summer and we were running the Wing-T, said Riverside coach Mickey Roussel. But we knew hed be a spread quarterback. We ran the spread late in his sophomore year, and ever since it was an adjustment but we exceeded expectations last season. And this season, his success didnt surprise me.Hes a special kid. Very humble. Its been a pleasure to coach him the last two seasons.Martin makes his second consecutive All-State team. The 62, 240 pound tackle anchored the Rebel line again this season, creating holes for Rachal, tailback Thomas Crouch, and the rest of the Rebel weapons to dash through.He might be the best overall lineman weve had (at Riverside), said Roussel. Weve had some bigger, had some stronger, but hes smart, versatile, and hes a technician. He can play Center, guard and tackle. I know some are concerned about his height at the next level, but someone is going to get a steal.Hall showed what he could do in a full season after an injury abbreviated his 2009 season for St. Charles. He scored 31 overall touchdowns and piled up 2,500 all-purpose yards. Four touchdowns came on kick or punt returns.He was a big threat on special teams, so much so that by the end of the year, nobody gave him a chance in the kicking game, said St. Charles coach Frank Monica. He was so versatile as a return man, a runner, a receiver, and a Wildcat quarterback. He was a threat to beat the defense in so many ways.Scioneaux was a reliable target for first year starting quarterback Donnie Savoie. At 6-foot-6, 215 pounds, he was equally effective as a blocker and receiver.Not just a good blocker, he really came on as a threat over the middle for us, said Monica. He stretched the field for us.Smith and Hitt were leaders on a St. Charles defense that pressured the quarterback and created turnovers all season long. Smiths versatility was valuable he could play on the line or as a pass-rushing linebacker for SCC.He was a guy you simply had to block, said Monica. He was (rushing) most of the time and he made plays all over the field. He had a lot of hurries and pressures.Meanwhile, Hitts nose for the football and head for the game set him apart at cornerback.Hes instinctive, very instinctive, said Monica. He had a knack for picking off and batting the ball down in coverage. He also had good size in run support. At 185, hes a big corner by our standards and that helped us hold up against perimeter runs.Keating continued a tradition of strong play in the Comets kicking game. The punter wasnt called upon that often thanks to a strong SCC offense, but he was extremely effective in pinning opponents back when needed.He could pin you inside the 20, and thanks to those long kicks and the hangtime he put on it, he could turn the field completely around, said Monica.He was extremely valuable.

description.hltext_display: Paulinenauer Männer feiern in Pritzwalk zwei Siege in der Landesklasse Nord
description.content:
PRITZWALK - Ihr Ziel, die Tabellenführung in der Landesklasse Nord zu behaupten, haben die Volleyball-Männer des Paulinenaue/Hertefelder TSV am letzten Spieltag dieses Jahres in Pritzwalk erreicht. Gegen die Vertretungen von Gastgeber VfV 68 Pritzwalk (3:0) und den Werderaner VV II (3:1) setzten sich die Havelland jeweils recht souverän durch.
Gegen Pritzwalk spielten die Paulinenauer von Beginn an entschlossen auf und gewannen den ersten Satz mit 25:13. Im zweiten Durchgang hielten die Gastgeber anfangs bis zum 9:9 mit. Dann mussten sie die Paulinenauer ziehen lassen, die letztlich mit 25:18 vorn lagen. Auch der dritte Satz war mit 25:11 eine klare Sache für die Gäste, obwohl deren Hauptangreifer Tommy Muhl verletzt ausfiel.
Im zweiten Spiel gegen Werder kamen die Paulinenauer anfangs nicht richtig in die Gänge. So verbuchten die Blütenstädter Satz eins mit 25:12 für sich. Dies wirkte auf Seiten der Havelländer wie ein Weckruf. Im zweiten Abschnitt wendete sich das Blatt. Mit einem 25:13 glichen die Paulinenauer nach Sätzen aus. Und im nächsten Durchgang bogen sie mit einem 25:18 in die Siegerstraße ein. Mit einem klaren 25:13 im vierten Satz machten die Paulinenauer ihren 3:1-Erfolg perfekt.
Mit diesen beiden Spielgewinnen baute das Team aus Paulinenaue sein Führung in der Tabelle sogar aus, da Verfolger SF Brandenburg 94 II zur gleichen Zeit beim 0:3 auswärts gegen Fortuna Kyritz patzte. (Von Peter Möcks)

description.hltext_display: Во Внуково задержан иранский валютный контрабандист
description.content:
22.12 05:29 MIGnews.com Представители московской таможни задержали в аэропорту Внуково трех граждан Азербайджана и одного гражданина Ирана при попытке незаконного ввоза крупной денежной суммы в иностранной валюте на территорию Российской Федерации.
У иранца и азербайджанцев изъяты 14 миллионов долларов 4,4 миллиона евро. Источник денег и место их назначения пока не выяснены.
Валютным контрабандистам, по российским законам, грозит суровое наказание – до 5 лет тюремного заключения. РАСПЕЧАТАТЬ Все по теме Россия Послание свыше

description.hltext_display: HDM-Titel für Janne Engeleiter
description.content:
PREMNITZ - In Erfurt trafen sich am vergangenen Wochenende mehr als 200 Leichtathleten mit Handicap aus insgesamt sieben Ländern, um in der modernen Halle am Steigerwaldstadion die besten Sportler zu ermitteln. Mit dabei war auch Janne Engeleiter vom TSV Chemie Premnitz, die in vier Disziplinen an den Start ging.
Da diese Hallenmeisterschaften wegen wichtiger internationaler Folgewettkämpfe am vierten Adventswochenende und damit mitten in der Trainingsphase der Leichtathleten stattfanden, waren alle auf die Ergebnisse gespannt.
Gemeinsam mit ihrem Trainer, Heinz Zahn, hatte sich Janne gut auf diesen Wettkampf vorbereitet, wenn auch der frühe Wintereinbruch das Weitsprungtraining auf dem Sportplatz etwas eingeschränkt hatte.
Nach einem spannenden Weitsprungwettbewerb sicherte sich Janne am Sonnabend mit mehr als 50 Punkten Vorsprung den Meistertitel im Weitsprung der weiblichen Jugend B vor Meike Hausberger aus Trier.
Ein guter Start im Sprint über die 60 Meter und eine runde Laufleistung in Bestzeit bis ins Ziel bescherten Janne souverän den zweiten Meistertitel des Tages mit 236 Punkten Vorsprung zur Zweitplatzierten Bashira Taher aus Saarbrücken. Gut motiviert ging Janne in den dritten Wettkampf und holte im Kugelstoßen mit der vier Kilogramm schweren Kugel mit einer Weite von 7,53 Meter den dritten Meistertitel des Tages.
Der so erfolgreiche Tag fand in gemeinsamer Runde mit allen Brandenburger Athleten auf dem schönen Erfurter Weihnachtsmarkt mit seiner beeindruckenden Kulisse seinen Abschluss.
Am Sonntag lieferte sich Janne Engeleiter über die 200-Meter-Sprintstrecke ein spannendes Rennen mit Maike Hausberger. Beide gehören seit Herbst 2010 zum C-Kader der Nationalmannschaft und kennen sich von gemeinsamen Trainingslagern und Wettkämpfen. Beide Sprinterinnen lieferten sich ein schnelles und kämpferisches Rennen, beide erzielten neue Bestzeiten in der Halle. Am Ende gratulierte Janne ihrer Sportfreundin Meike, die nach Umrechnung in Punkte den ersten Platz über die 200 Meter belegte.
Die internationalen deutschen Hallenmeisterschaften in Erfurt bildeten für die Athleten den Abschluss eines erfolgreichen Wettkampfjahres 2010 im Behindertensport. Im Jahr 2011 stehen wieder viele nationale, aber auch internationale Wettkämpfe im Behindertensport auf dem Plan. (ea)

description.hltext_display: Южная Корея начинает масштабные маневры на границе с КНДР
description.content:
22.12 09:34 MIGnews.com Южная Корея открывает масштабные военные учения вблизи границы с КНДР.
Представитель армии республики ЮК сообщил, что в 20 километрах к югу от границы, на полигоне Почеон начнутся крупнейшие в своем роде учения наземных и воздушных войск, которые будут включать в себя боевые стрельбы.
По его словам, маневры станут ответом на обстрел острова Йопхендо в Желтом море в прошлом месяце, в результате которого погибли 2 военнослужащих и 2 гражданских лиц. При этом подчеркивается, что Сеул не собирается мстить Пхеньяну за нападение, а речь идет об учениях по отражению возможной атаки. РАСПЕЧАТАТЬ Все по теме Корея ФОТО ФОТО

description.hltext_display: Five Qantas A380s to hit skies by Christmas
description.content:
Qantas says it will have five Airbus A380s in the air by Christmas.
The airline made the announcement in its monthly traffic report today.
Qantas returned two A380s to service on November 27, more than three weeks after an engine explosion on November 4 caused the airline to ground its entire fleet of the giant double-decker aircraft.
The carrier returned a third A380 from its existing fleet to service last week after inspections were completed in Los Angeles, and it took delivery of a new A380 over the weekend.
The A380 fleet will swell to five tomorrow after another returns from inspections in Frankfurt.
The airline was using the A380s on flights from Sydney to London via Singapore only and not to the US, where extra engine thrust is required due to shorter runways at Los Angeles airport.
The next priority was resuming A380 services to London via Singapore from Melbourne, a Qantas spokesman said on Wednesday.
Qantas was due to take delivery of two A380s this month, but the spokesman said the delivery date for that aircraft slipped into January.
It was hoped the airline would have seven A380s in the air by the end of next month.
The aircraft which suffered the "uncontained engine failure" remains in Singapore.
- AAP

event_or_fact.property: caused the airline to ground its entire fleet of the giant double-decker aircraft

description.hltext_display: NCC╱年代綜合台節目廣告化嚴重 遭決議撤照
description.content:
國家通訊傳播委員會（NCC）今（22）日以年代綜合台節目未與廣告區分情節，節目廣告化嚴重，因此決議撤照，並核處新台幣210萬元罰款。
NCC發言人陳正倉表示，經營年代的大禾多媒體公司，於93年2月27日取得執照，至99年2月26日屆滿6年。這段期間已經違反相關法令規定達49次、裁罰總金額達1675萬。
NCC鑑於年代綜合台違規紀錄高，於99年2月26日發函給年代綜合台，告知許可年代綜合台換照，但屬於有條件換照。NCC當時決議，若換照日起1年內有違反《衛星廣播電視法》第17條或第19條第1項(節目應維持完整性並與廣告區分)，或換照日起6個月內節目首播率未達40%，將予撤照。
NCC表示，年代綜合台今年2月份換發執照時，當時NCC鑑於該台多次違反衛星廣播電視法有關節目與廣告必須區分的規定，因此做出附款，明定1年內如果再違規，就將撤照，不過因為情況並未改善，因此決議撤照。

description.hltext_display: Dritten Gesamtplatz gefestigt
description.content:
DOHA/FALKENSEE - Weitestgehend Wind- und Funkstille herrschte am Montag bei den Junioren-Weltmeisterschaften der Segler in der olympischen 470er Klasse in Doha (Katar). Wegen der Flaute wurden die Qualifikationsrennen an diesem Tag abgesagt.
Die unvorhergesehene Pause schien aber der deutschen Crew mit der Falkenseer Steuerfrau Annika Bochmann und ihrer Berliner Vorschoterin Anika Lorenz sehr gut getan zu haben. Denn die zweifachen Junioren-Europameisterinnen vom Verein Seglerhaus am Wannsee feierten gestern in der sechsten Wettfahrt ihren ersten Sieg bei der WM. Sie setzten sich vor ihren deutschen Teamkolleginnen Tina Lutz und Susann Beucke sowie den Niederländerinnen Nina Keijzer und Anneloes van Veen durch.
Mit diesem Erfolg festigten Annika Bochmann und Anika Lorenz ihren dritten Platz in der Gesamtwertung und sind damit so gut wie sicher für das Medaillenrennen der besten zehn Boote qualifiziert, das für heute vorgesehen ist. Weiter in Führung liegen die Japanerinnen Saki Goto und Hiromi Nishiyama vor den Berlinerinnen Victoria Jurczok und Josephine Bach, aber die Abstände an der Spitze sind geringer geworden. Gestern sollten noch zwei weitere Qualifikationsrennen stattfinden, deren Ergebnisse aber bis zum Redaktionsschluss dieser Seite noch nicht vorlagen. (Von Axel Eifert)

description.hltext_display: 456年來 紅通通月全食遇冬至竟是大凶？
description.content:
冬至碰上難得一見的月全食，這可是456年來的第一次，21日的天文奇觀讓人大呼過癮，紅通通的月亮卻也讓人穿鑿附會說有「大凶」來臨，信者恆信，聽聽就好。2011年還有2次月全食，日期分別為6月15日及12月10日，6月的月全食臺灣地區可見「月沒帶食」，12月10日的月全食臺灣地區全程可見。
月食是當月亮運行到地球和太陽之間的陰影帶時，原本照射到月亮的陽光被地球完全擋住，就會發生月全食現象，此時，月亮、地球和太陽恰好處在一條直線上，如果月食發生在晚間，人們將能目睹月亮逐漸變暗然後再恢復光明的過程。冬至碰上月全食，這可是456年來的第一次，最好的觀賞地點是在北美洲。
美國東部時間21日凌晨1點開始，太陽光線被地球所擋住形成的陰影投射到月球表面，陰影慢慢的擴大，但是月亮並不會完全變黑，反而出現暗紅色，讓整個月全食，披上一層神秘的面紗，以及許多穿鑿附會的傳說。在台灣地區，傍晚5點07分左右看見月亮，此時月亮已經在逐漸復圓中，只能看見後半段的月偏食。
據新華網報導，在中國南京市民觀看到的只是月食的「尾巴」。俗話說「十五的月亮十六圓」，但是昨天這個「十六的月亮」看起來並不圓，與平常不同。此時看到的月亮只有半個，呈鴨蛋黃的暗紅色，特別美麗，「帶食」緩緩東升，隨著地平高度逐漸上升，月亮逐漸變成暗黃色，也越來越圓。直到傍晚6時01分月亮才完全復圓。
在冬至這天發生月全食，是在456年前的西元1554年，當年是英國都鐸王朝最陰暗的一年，珍格雷才當了9天的女王，就被貴族推翻，並且以叛國罪名處決。因此，有人便說這樣的天文「巧合」不好、不吉利，但是沒有科學根據足以佐證。
錯過這次月全食也不要失望，據台北市立天文科學教育館網站指出，2011年日月食方面，全球發生2次月食與4次日食，2次月食均為月全食，日期為6月15日及12月10日，6月15日的月全食臺灣地區可見「月沒帶食」，12月10日的月全食臺灣地區全程可見。至於4次日食均為日偏食，分別為1月4日、6月1日、7月1日及11月25日，臺灣地區都無法得見。

description.hltext_display: Похищен сын главы мусульман юга России
description.content:
22.12 10:39 MIGnews.com 26-летний Наиль Бикмаев пропал прямо из двора собственного дома. Как рассказали Life News в правоохранительных органах Ростова-на-Дону, имам одной из городских мечетей Наиль Бикмаев был похищен неизвестными преступниками, когда он всего на несколько минут вышел из дома.
- Наиля похитили прямо со двора. Он зашел в дом, поговорил с родителями и вышел на улицу, - рассказывает Life News источник в ростовской мечети. - Когда стали его искать нашли только ключницу и мобильный, в котором не было сим-карты.
Похищенный - сын главы духовного управления мусульман юга России и Ростова-на-Дону, имам городской мечети.
Чтобы не привлекать внимание преступников, к поискам сына муфтий привлек родственников и знакомых. Пока похитители не связывались с муфтием и не выдвигали никаких требований. LifeNews РАСПЕЧАТАТЬ Все по теме

description.hltext_display: Los Bucks dan la sorpresa en el Staples
description.author: Antonio Martín Guirado (Efe
description.content:
Matt Barnes intenta conseguir la canasta ante la oposición de Andrew Bogut. | Afp
Apoyados en Earl Boykins suman un meritorio triunfo pese a las bajas de hombres importantes como Jennings, Maggette, Delfino o Michael Redd
Los Grizzlies caen ante los Nets con 19 puntos y 4 rebotes de Marc
Antonio Martín Guirado (Efe) | EEUU
Comentarios0
Los Milwaukee Bucks se olvidaron de las importantes bajas por lesión en su plantilla y frustraron desde la defensa a Los Ángeles Lakers (79-98), que firmaron uno de sus peores encuentros de la temporada justo cuando se avecina el duelo frente a los Miami Heat. [Resultados y clasificación]
Los locales, que regresaban a Los Ángeles tras una gira de siete partidos como visitantes, se desfondaron en la segunda mitad, donde anotaron 33 puntos total, 13 de ellos en el último cuarto. El base Earl Boykins, el jugador más bajo de la Liga, se convirtió en la estrella del duelo, con 22 puntos. "Estuvo acertado esta noche. No lo ha estado en todo el año y llega aquí y las ha metido casi todas", reconoció Gasol al término del partido. El turco Ersan Ilyasova contribuyó con 17 tantos y 11 rebotes. Por las filas de los Lakers destacaron Kobe Bryant, con 21 puntos, y Pau Gasol, con 15 tantos y 11 rebotes.
Se trataba de un partido trampa para los angelinos. Los Bucks se presentaban en el Staples Center con tres bajas sensibles (Brandon Jennings, Carlos Delfino y Corey Maggette), y para los locales resultaba inevitable tener en mente el próximo envite: el día de Navidad, frente a los Heat de LeBron James. Sorprendió el entonado arranque de la pareja interior formada por Andrew Bogut e Ilyasova, que se combinaron para anotar 16 de los 25 puntos de su equipo en el primer cuarto, mientras Gasol y Lamar Odom tomaban las riendas de los suyos para recortar (22-25) una renta que llegó a ser de siete para los de Scott Skiles.
La entrada en cancha de los reservas igualó el duelo, con la aportación del diminuto Boykins y Larry Sanders por un lado y la explosividad de los 'killer b's' (Steve Blake, Matt Barnes, Shannon Brown) por otro, aunque fueron los centímetros de Andrew Bynum, a pesar de su lentitud y de su visible cojera, los que mantuvieron a raya a los Bucks al descanso (46-50).
Los Lakers flojeaban en cuanto a ejecución en ataque e intensidad defensiva. Y en esa tesitura apareció Ron Artest para imprimir carácter a ambos lados de la cancha. Su actividad y ganas contagiaron a sus compañeros, a pesar de que el tándem Bogut-Ilyasova seguía causando estragos bajo el aro de los Lakers. Los Bucks, con un Boykins ejemplar en la dirección y Salmons acertado en el tiro, sorprendieron con un último cuarto estelar en el que fueron aumentando su ventaja en los instantes finales hasta alcanzar una brecha superior a los 20 puntos (77-98).
Los constantes errores en el tiro de los locales y el magnífico esfuerzo defensivo de los de Skiles resultaron determinantes. Los Lakers pagaron toda la apatía y los constantes toques de atención -sin respuesta- que fueron recibiendo a lo largo del duelo, e incluso llegaron a perder los papeles con la expulsión de Bryant por protestar a uno de los árbitros. Tras el encuentro Pau Gasol ha reconocido el buen papel del rival: "Contábamos con ganar este partido, pero ellos han jugado bien. Hay que darles mérito porque han hecho un encuentro completo, han jugado duro, no se han venido abajo y han sabido aprovechar nuestros errores. Además han hecho un último cuarto casi mejor imposible". El día de Navidad acecha y Miami aguarda su turno.
Marc, líder en la derrota de los Grizzlies
El pívot Brook López aportó 26 puntos, el reserva Sasha Vujacic agregó 16, su mejor cifra en la campaña, y los New Jersey Nets detuvieron una racha de 10 derrotas fuera de su campo al vencer 101-94 a los Memphis Grizzlies, liderados por el pívot español Marc Gasol (19 puntos y cuatro rebotes). El reserva O.J. Mayo lo apoyó con 17 puntos, 11 de ellos en el último cuarto, y el base Mike Conley terminó con 13. Se trata de la tercera victoria en los últimos cuatro partidos para la franquicia gobernada por el magnate ruso Mikhail Prokhorov.

description.hltext_display: City OKs Hayes deal
description.author: Rob Crow
description.content:
CARBONDALE - The on Tuesday approved a sale of the Eurma C. Hayes Center to a locally operated nonprofit corporation, created solely to operate the building.
The council unanimously approved the city's sale of the center to the , which will assume ownership of the building by the end of the year. As the foundation works to secure grants, the city will provide some financial help, giving the corporation a grant that will cover the estimated cost of utilities through April.
The building itself is only being sold for $10, but the city could save tens of thousands of dollars per year by not having to pay for utilities and upkeep.
But of more importance to those who have spent time in the building and used its services, the sale is more significant than that.
"I'm hopeful and joyful that there is someone who has stepped up to the challenge," Councilman Steven Haynes said. "I'm hopeful that this will become a building for the whole Carbondale community, not just the northeast side."
The building is home to several programs, including Attucks Community Services, I Can Read! and the Carbondale branch of the NAACP. In his 2009 State of the City address, Mayor Brad Cole proposed that the city look at alleviating itself of the building and the costs associated with running it.
A request earlier this year for purchase proposals netted only one response: from , which was formed by James Scales, and the board of which includes relatives of Hayes.
"I would like to commend the board for stepping up to the plate," Councilwoman Corene McDaniel said. "I would hope and pray the community will rally behind you and be supportive."
New clerk appointed
Also at Tuesday's meeting, the council unanimously approved the appointment of Rachel Keehn as the city's new clerk. Keehn will begin her new post Feb. 18, the same day that longtime clerk Janet Vaught will retire.
A native of Carterville, Keehn graduated from and the SIU School of Law. She will start working for the city Jan. 3 as an assistant in the clerk's office.

description.hltext_display: Jonesboro school tax levy won’t increase
description.content:
The , meeting Tuesday night at the grade school, heard plenty of comments about a proposed 4.5 percent increase in the tax levy, but ultimately decided unanimously to make no increase at all in the levy.
The move came at the recommendation of Superintendent Gary Hill, who explained that as the equalized assessed valuation of properties in the district increases, more money will be collected even at the same levy rate.
"As the EAV goes up, taxes go down," Hill said. He added that the additional money collected if the levy were increased - roughly $18,000 - wouldn't be worth the turmoil caused in the district over the increase.
Hill said the $350,000 in state aid paid to the district this year came from the state's use of federal stimulus funds, but questioned where next year's state aid will come from.
Gail Short and her daughter, Katie, had numerous questions for the board, asking if it had considered selling surplus property or cutting administrative jobs to cut costs instead of raising taxes. Katie Short also videotaped the proceedings. Both women suggested the board ask the public for cost-cutting suggestions.
The board also tabled a proposal to participate in a feasibility study of consolidating several school districts. Cunningham Enterprises in Anna has offered to help fund the study, but the district also would have some expenses from the study, Hill said.
An executive session was called to discuss "personnel, negotiations, student disciplinary cases, student placement and/or pending legislation," according to the agenda. Action on several issues was expected to be taken after the executive session.
linda.rush@thesouthern.com / 618-351-5079

description.hltext_display: Timothy Jay White
description.content:
Born in Portland, Tim was the son of Donald and Barbara White. He graduated from Westbrook High School, Dean College and the University of Southern Maine. He was a proud Eagle Scout from Troop 70 Prides Corner, Westbrook. After the sudden death of his father, Donald, in 1980, Tim left college for a short period of time to run the family business, White Brothers, with his brother Michael. After Donalds death the business truly became White Brothers as they worked together to build the business into a well known, highly respected general contractor specializing in earthwork, roads and utilities. He served in almost every capacity of the business, and at his death had been general superintendent and vice president for many years. He loved and cared for the many men and women who worked for him over the years, and was recently eulogized as a kind and gentle man. He was well known for his quick wit and sense of humor, often playing practical jokes on employees throughout the day.
He married the former Dorothy Patla in 1989, and the two began raising their family of three daughters in the home they built on Forest Lake in Cumberland. They moved to Yarmouth in 1999, and Tim always said that it was one of the best decisions they ever made. He enjoyed working on their historic home on Greely Road and took great pride in maintaining its historic value. He also valued the many friends he made in the Yarmouth community.
In 2007, Tim was awarded the Real Heroes Lifesaving Award from the American Red Cross of Southern Maine for helping to save the life of a fellow basketball player after he collapsed on the court during a mens league game. As a natural jokester, he got great mileage out of calling himself Yarmouths Hero, and used that title in his many humorous speeches within the community.
Prior to the ALS diagnosis, Tim enjoyed skiing at Sugarloaf Mountain with his loved ones and playing basketball in the Town of Yarmouths mens league. Growing up, Tim developed a deep love of fishing while spending summers at the family camp on Little Sebago Lake. One of his greatest enjoyments as an adult was spending time at his lakeside cabin on Foss Pond, fishing its waters, always with his favorite Brittany, Hallie, along side him in the boat.
Tim coached youth basketball when his daughters were young, and in recent years was an active member of the Yarmouth Basketball Boosters. As president of the boosters,
he was instrumental in the construction of the outdoor basketball courts at Yarmouth High School.
Tim served on the Board of Directors of the Westbrook Hospital, as well as on the Family Council of the Dystonia Medical Research Foundation. Through his personal and business life, his philanthropy reached many local nonprofits, including Riding to the Top Therapeutic Riding Center in Gray and the Morrison Center in Scarborough, as well as the Yarmouth youth basketball programs. He had a soft heart and easy, generous manner.
Tim was an active, warm, loving, and often very funny and entertaining person. Underneath the jokes and humor was a strong, supportive husband and father who always put his family first. He will be affectionately remembered as Papa White to many teenagers in Yarmouth.
He was predeceased by his father, Donald in 1980, and his oldest daughter, Annie Veronica, in 2005.
Besides his wife, Dorothy, he will be greatly missed by his daughters, Elizabeth Beth White and Rachel White, both of Yarmouth; his mother, Barbara White of Portland; his brother Michael and wife, Nikki, of Westbrook; and many nieces and nephews.
A celebration of Tims life was held Saturday, Dec. 18, 2010 the First Parish Congregational Church in Yarmouth with the Rev.s Kent Allen and Robert White, cousin of Tim, officiating.
Interment will follow in the family lot at Moss Side Cemetery in Cumberland.
In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made in Tims memory to ALS Northern New England Chapter, c/o The Concord Center, 10 Ferry St. Suite 438, Box 314, Concord, New Hampshire 03301, or to Yarmouth Basketball Boosters C/O Andrew Smith 23 Storer St, Yarmouth, Maine 04096.
Please visit www.jonesrichandhutchins.com for additional information and to sign Tims guestbook.

entity.property: general superintendent and vice president for many years

description.hltext_display: Gujjar protests affect Rajasthan rail, road traffic |
description.content:
JAIPUR: The agitation by the Gujjar community, led by , entered the second day on Tuesday disrupting road and rail traffic in the Bharatpur district of Rajasthan.
Authorities have diverted several trains and stopped buses on two routes, official sources said.
Janshatabdi Express and Jamunabridge Express have been cancelled while movement of two dozen other trains has been affected in the Bharatpur-Sawaimadhopur section, they said.
A Rajasthan State Road Transport Corporation official said that buses on the Hindaun-Bayana and Hindaun-Bharatpur routes have been stopped due to the agitation.
Security forces have been deployed in Pilukapur area as the agitators are camping at the Delhi-Mumbai rail tracks near the region, a senior police official said.
"Additional forces of Reserved Armed Constabulary, Railway Protection Force and Government Railway Police have been deployed for the security of railway stations, rail tracks and nearby areas," the official said.
The Gujjars led by Bainsla started an agitation on Monday in Bharatpur district to press for their demand for reservation for the community, even as the Gehlot government stated that it would try to solve the issue through talks.

description.hltext_display: Voice of the Reader 12-22
description.content:
Bully article was insightful
To the Editor:
Your recent report featuring bullying education for Southern Illinois University Carbondale student teachers was encouraging particularly because the writer noted that teachers are role models whether they accept that role or not. Students interact with teachers far more than the average three and a half minutes of daily conversation between teens and parents. Hopefully the training included more than statistics and the concluding suggestion that teachers should post rules.
Children of all ages need to be certain enough
of their own value that a bully's verbal remarks remain meaningless to their ears. Directing a child
to tell an adult or ask for help or retaliate with an insult drops that child back into the victim role
and gives the bully exactly what he/she needs, a reaction; i.e., acknowledgement of their self-imagined power.
Instead of responding to "Your mother is a _____!" (fill in current insult) with "She is not!!" or running to the principal's office, try a simple "Oh, hi, Joe." And go on your merry way.
The potential bully gets her/his desperately needed attention, is surprised and off balance, and any escalation of tension dissolves.
For a more extensive understanding of nonviolent communication, see Marshall Rosenberg's website, ww.cnvc.org. To increase your skills for averting bullying behavior, see Izzy Kalberg's website, www.bullies2buddies.com. Use of these resources can make a positive difference in the classroom, on the playground and in the workplace.
Judy Ashby

description.hltext_display: Voice of The Southern: Cross is gift for all Southern Illinois
description.content:
Our View: The restoration of Bald Knob Cross of Peace shows what can be accomplished when we work together for the betterment of Southern Illinois.
There are obvious must-see attractions across Southern Illinois, including the blue waters of Rend Lake, Garden of the Gods in Shawnee National Forest, Giant City State Park and the bluffs overlooking the Mississippi and Ohio rivers.
Obviously the list is lengthy and this isn't an attempt to report everyone's favorite vista. But even people new to our beautiful green region probably expect mention of towering Bald Knob Cross of Peace - either from the cross's base atop Bald Knob Mountain, the scenic overlook in Alto Pass or perhaps their own favorite spot.
It may be the best-known tourism attraction in our region, an iconic structure that draws visitors from around the world, from a myriad of religious backgrounds, for the scenic splendor and restful contemplation of peace, hope, love and faith - the words chiseled into the heavy stone blocks at the foundation of the cross.
Now, as Christmas looms near, it seems an especially fitting gift to the region that a restoration project that once seemed more of a dream than a goal has restored the 111-foot-tall tower to full scenic glory. Perhaps you saw our front page photo of the cross Tuesday and were equally impressed. It is a beautiful gift for everyone.
We all have reason to thank the Friends of the Cross organization and everyone involved in the project for an outstanding accomplishment: Those who treasure our rich history and culture; those who find the cross as a strengthening expression of their personal faith; those who wish to share our scenic beauty with tourists; and even nonbelievers who enjoy the serenity and beauty of a place that somehow elicits the best behaviors from visitors.
Though it may sound like a cliché, some view the restoration of the cross as a Christmas miracle. Legal battling prevented any full-scale restoration efforts before Christmas Eve 2008, when a settlement was reached. It took two years of intense fundraising efforts and rivers of perspiration from the workers who created a modern-day version of the cross as it stood in 1963 - when the final porcelain-coated steel panels were placed on the iron framework completed for the 1959 Easter Sunrise Service.
This was no easy feat. Ask anyone about the difficulty of raising money during a recessed economy, in a region beset with un-employment.
Friends of the Cross announced in its Christmas newsletter it had raised more than $400,000, which exceeded the group's initial goal of $300,000. With more than half a million in total raised through various groups' efforts and the restoration of the exterior of the cross complete, Friends of the Cross won't organize further fundraising efforts and plans to disband after an atheist's lawsuit is settled over a small portion of the cross' restoration funding. The suit is without merit and should be dismissed, we believe, and reported elsewhere in today's paper that such an action appears likely in court.
As reported Tuesday, the only work remaining on the cross will be completed in better weather - lighting at the base of the structure and a courtyard of engraved bricks.
Steve McKeown, president of the Bald Knob Cross of Peace Foundation board of directors, said officials will gather for a ceremony at the cross at noon Christmas Eve. Friday marks two years to the day a court ordered stewardship of the cross to be taken over by a transitional board.
"We know it will be a small dedication, as many people have other places to be on Christmas Eve, nonetheless we are going to do it to mark the date," McKeown said.
What a fitting conclusion to a story seemingly too good to be true. For those who doubt our abilities to overcome steep odds, we suggest looking at the Bald Knob Cross of Peace and remember the peeling, rusting and unlit shadow of past glory that stood for too long at the crest of Bald Knob Mountain. Don't you dare tell the people of Southern Illinois that something can't be done, the job is too hard, we don't have enough money or that our people resist change.
We can make this region into whatever we want. Just look at the cross if you've got any doubts.
Feedback: We want to hear what you have to say. Type your thoughts about our editorials by clicking on the "discussion" tab in the online version of this opinion at www.thesouthern.com/news/opinion/ If you want to see your comments in the newspaper, e-mail them directly to gary.metro@thesouthern.com along with your name, address and telephone number.

description.hltext_display: AIDS project looking to help 25 more families
description.author: Codell Rodriguez
description.content:
The Southern Illinois AIDS Holiday Project is just 25 families away from providing Christmas to households living with AIDS, and they need the region's support.
Project chairman Wally Paynter said 125 homes have received grocery gift cards and most have received gifts. However, there are still 25 households to help, including eight with children. He said most households are asking for simple donations such as clothing and toys for the children.
"We're not going all-out and extravagant," Paynter said. "We're just looking for the basics."
The project provides Christmas gifts for low-income families in the southern 19 counties affected by AIDS. One hundred percent of the donations go to Southern Illinois families. The support is needed so that the deliveries can be made by Friday night. He said he is confident that the project will be able to help all of the families who have asked for help.
"We have struggled a little bit, but I still think by Friday night we'll have accomplished the project," Paynter said.
He encouraged everyone to give so that families who need help having a Merry Christmas will be able to celebrate with a few extra gifts under the tree.
"These are people who could really use the help," Paynter said.
codell.rodriguez@thesouthern.com / 618-351-5804

description.hltext_display: Armed robbery suspect’s bond set at $500,000
description.content:
MARION - A 38-year-old Murphysboro man is suspected of wielding a large screwdriver and wrench early Monday during the robbery of two Williamson County retail outlets. Phillip Palmer set bond at $500,000 on Tuesday during a court hearing for who remains in . Williamson County Assistant State Attorney Sean de Mello said he filed two Class X felonies against Lockard in connection to the robberies that occurred after midnight Sunday. Palmer was arrested later Monday morning. Class X felony convictions carry six- to 30-year prison sentences, de Mello said.
The first incident occurred at the Liquor Box on Illinois 37 between Marion and Johnston City at about 12:30 a.m. Monday, according to Williamson County Sheriff's Department. The suspect entered the store with a large screwdriver and robbed the store employee of $15 before leaving the scene in a pickup truck.
The employee fought with the suspect and each suffered minor injuries. The employee knew the suspect and was able to give law authorities a name and vehicle description.
The second incident occurred minutes later at the Gas Mart Stotlar Road and Park Avenue in Herrin, police said.
A suspect described as Lockard entered the store with a large screwdriver and large wrench, according to a news release from Sheriff Bennie Vick.
He demanded money from the clerk and left with an undisclosed amount of cash.
Several hours later, the Jackson County Sheriff's Office received a call of a possible drug overdose and discovered it was Lockard. He was taken to a hospital and later interviewed by a Williamson County sheriff's detective. He was booked on the two armed robbery charges.

description.hltext_display: Herrin man wins $5.4 million in Lottery
description.content:
HERRIN - Minnie Reams complained to her husband Bobby for years that he wasted money each week playing the Illinois Lottery.
The Herrin man did so for nearly 30 years, purchasing tickets in advance of the multi-drawings conducted weekly. Bobby Reams strategy was to play a single set of numbers and stick with it.
Minnie's complaining was all for naught. Bobby's strategy paid off. His numbers hit the $4.5 million Lotto jackpot from the Nov. 6 drawing. Red Liquor, 120 Cherry St., sold Reams his winning ticket.
"I'm kind of a private person. I thought I would slip by everyone," Bobby Reams said during a telephone interview about the aftermath of fame and notoriety that has befallen upon him.
When a Red Liquor store clerk told Reams a few days later after scanning his winning ticket that the retired Norge employee and coal mine worker who served in the U.S. National Guard for 30 years was a millionaire, Reams said he was "shocked" and still has not adjusted to the reality of the new life that awaits him.
"I've been real fortunate. Everyone has been congratulating me and telling me it couldn't have happened to a better person," Reams said.
He and Minnie have not decided how they are going to spend the money. They are talking of purchasing a new house and sharing their after-tax fortune with their children and grandchildren.
Red Top Liquor will receive a $45,000 bonus that equates to 1 percent of the jackpot for selling the winning ticket, according to the Illinois Lottery.

description.hltext_display: Lasati-o ca macane
description.author: piticu
description.content:
Basescu vine si se da lovit . Culmea, Ponta vine si zice ca Basescu e de vina. Pe langa astia doi s-a trezit si Antonescu ca e sunat sa se dea cu parerea. Subiectul e cel trist, dar just si drept: Franta si Germania recomanda ca Romania sa nu intre in zona Schengen.
A intra in zona Schengen inseamna sa treci asa, dintr-o tara intr-alta fara sa te intrebe nimeni de sanatate. Adica ai putea sa cari orice, sa te plimbi linistit fara sa dai explicatii ca ce, de ce, cum si unde, in ce scop. Pe langa masurile de securitate ce implica acest lucru, asta inseamna si o crestere a economiei, transporturilor, comertului liber si tot ce decurge de aici. Adica producatorul de lapte de la Alba, daca nu se mai intelege cu fabrica sa vanda laptele cu 0.9 lei pe litru (!!!) se poate duce in Slovacia sa zicem, sa-l vanda mai bine.
Si noi nu meritam sa fim in Schengen. Bai nu se poate sa fim cacatul Europei si noua sa ni se rupa de asta. Si aici ma refer direct la Basescu care se da lovit si mirat, la Ponta care se ocupa de alte tampenii in loc sa vorbeasca cand trebuie. Adica a fost cancelarul Germaniei in Romania si a dat ditamai muia ca noi suntem de 2 lei si ca nu vrem sa muncim. Noi nu vrem sa facem autostrazi, noi nu vrem sa eradicam coruptia. Cum pana mea sa ceri spaga pentru a construi autostrada pana la Brasov si apoi sa vii sa zici ca Romania e discriminata? Si eu ma intreb de ce nimeni din opozitie, nici Ponta si nici Antonescu si nici Boc si cine o mai fi prin viata asta politica n-au reactionat la faza cu Angela Merkel . Pe langa ca a venit cineva sa se amestece in politica interna a Romaniei toata clasa politica a tacut malc pe modelul: cacat, ne-a prins, las ca trece, o lasam asa si trece repede.
Deci lasati-o ca macane. Ca l-a refuzat Sharkozi pe Basescu la summit e fix acelasi lucru, se ducea sa se roage de viza. Ca nu a reusit nu e vina lui, e vina tuturor. E vina astora care blocheaza proiectele de investitii. E vina lui Boc si Berceanu/Boiagiu care inaugureaza 10 kilometri de autostrada. E vina dobitocilor de PNL-isti care cer bani de reparat biserici in loc sa vina cu un plan sigur si clar care sa fie aprobat.

description.hltext_display: Softing AG (DE0005178008) : DGAP-Adhoc: Softing Group - New Order from Premium Car Manufacturer
Softing AG (DE0005178008) : DGAP-News: Softing AG: Neuer Großauftrag von Premium-Automobilkonzern
Varannan damernas
description.author: Andreas Ekström
description.content:
Keith och jag. En berättelse om utanförskap och rättsröta. Blue.
en skånska journalisten Ingrid Carlqvists reportagebok ”Keith och jag” är drabbande läsning. Men det som griper tag allra mest, det är inte den redan ganska välkända berättelsen om den morddömde och senare friade Keith Cederholm, utan i stället Ingrid Carlqvists egna memoarer.
För det är vad detta är – också. Ingrid Carlqvist har tagit ett ovanligt grepp, och skriver sin egen livshistoria i vartannat kapitel, och Keith Cederholms i vartannat. Keith Cederholm dog i somras, men de var ungefär lika gamla. De kom från Helsingborg. Ingrid Carlqvist var vän med Keith Cederholms bror.
Spontant kan man undra vad Ingrid Carlqvists ”vanliga” liv har med Keith Cederholms tragiska och ovanliga öde att göra. Den frågan får inget riktigt tydligt svar under 375 sidor.
Ändå liksom … fungerar det. Jag märker hur jag gång på gång vill veta mer om Ingrid Carlqvist, hur jag otåligt tar mig fram genom de deprimerande förutsägbara händelserna i Keith Cederholms liv, för att i stället komma tillbaka och få veta mer om Ingrid Carlqvists dåliga kärleksrelationer, hennes barnlöshet, hennes journalistiska yrkesliv, hennes personliga och professionella drivkrafter och hennes förlust av en älskad bror.
Hon berättar helt enkelt bättre om sig själv än om bokens huvudperson. Eller så är det bara så att den utpräglade vardagligheten och den i positiv mening enkla hållningen till den egna livshistorien gör berättelsen om Ingrid Carlqvist till den mest intressanta i boken.
Keith Cederholm var dömd från början, inte rättsligt, utan mänskligt. Som hans liv skildras i den här boken är det svårt att se att han hade kunnat hamna ”rätt”, nästan vad som än hade hänt från sådär tolv års ålder och framåt. ”Keith och jag” väcker alltså alla de förväntade frågorna om arv och miljö och klass, men borrar sig inte vidare i den riktningen. I det pressmeddelande som medföljer boken lägger Ingrid Carlqvist och förlaget stor tonvikt på frågor om rättsröta – Keith Cederholm behandlades flera gånger fruktansvärt illa av både polis och åklagare och rätt, och hade knappast friats för det mord han dömdes för om inte några ambitiösa journalister med Jan Guillou i spetsen hade tagit sig an hans fall. Detta är kanske ett smart sätt att intressera journalister för boken som sådan, men det har trots allt inte så mycket med bokens slutliga utformning att göra.
Här finns i stället en bok som inte behöver motivera sin existens av att den skulle användas till något högre mål. Den ska främst bara läsas, medryckande, rapp och effektivt berättad som den är. Möjligen bara med andra poänger, kvaliteter och effekter än författaren främst avsåg.

description.hltext_display: Zumba Fitness Holiday Party - Lafayette - Dec. 22rd

description.hltext_display: Ofrece hacer justicia ¡el Cártel de Sinaloa!
description.content:
A través de dos mantas, se ofreció a hallar al asesino de Marisela Escobedo y acusó al Gobierno de protegerlo.
Ciudad Juárez, Chihuahua
Reducir/Ampliar
A través de dos mantas, el Cártel de Sinaloa se ofreció a dar con los homicidas de la activista Marisela Escobedo y acusó al Gobierno del Estado de protegerlos.
"EL CARTEL DE SINALOA SE SOLIDARIZA CON LOS FAMILIARES DE LA SRA. MARISELA ESCOBEDO Y CON EL PUEBLO CHIHUAHUENSE. A PROPORCIONARNOS DATOS PARA DAR CON LOS RESPONSABLES PAGINA QUITA PUERCOS. ASI SEAN LOS ZETAS O LA LINEA Y ACABAR CON ESTAS BESTIAS QUE EL GOB. DEL EDO. SIGUE PROTEGIENDO Y COMO MUESTRA LO QUE PASO. DENUNCIALOS ATTE. CDS.", se leyó en el mensaje.
Las mantas aparecieron ayer en dos distintos puntos de la Ciudad, una de ellos frente a la Cruz Roja Mexicana, en la Zona Pronaf, la cual es vigilada por decenas de agentes de la Policía Federal.
La otra manta fue colgada en un puente.
Marisela Escobedo fue asesinada el jueves pasado frente al Palacio de Gobierno, en la capital chihuahuense, donde mantenía un plantón en demanda de justicia para su hija Rubí Marisol Frayre, asesinada en 2008 y cuyo homicida confeso, su entonces novio, fue liberado por las autoridades.

description.hltext_display: Ellen Jacobson Loring
description.content:
NAPLES, Fla. & EASTPORT Ellen Jacobsen Loring, 87, died December 11, 2010, at her home in Naples, Fla. after a long illness.
She was born July 11, 1923, in Rotterdam, Holland, and immigrated to the United States with her parents in 1939.
She is predeceased by her parents Henriette and Joseph Jacobson of Paris, France and new York City; her husband Allison Loring formerly of Brooklyn, N.Y., Eastport, Southport and Naples, Fla.; and by her son, Roland Loring.
Together with Ellens parents, Allison and Ellen built Argenta Products Company in Eastport and New Jersey, which manufactured Pearlescence, also known as pearl essence. During her life in Eastport, Ellen served on numerous boards for education and health facilities. Ellen was also an artist specializing in textile and stenciling. She was a member of American Decorative Art Society and today her work can be viewed at the University of Maine in Orono. In Naples, she opened one of the first Needlepoint shops (Outlook too) where she shared her love of textiles with young and old. Ellen and her late husband, Allison gave many scholarships to students from Maine in order to help them continue their studies in the arts at the University of Maine. Ellen and Allison also supported the Naples symphony and hospital. Ellen will be remembered for her sophistication, elegance and loyalty. She was a loving mother, wife, daughter, and grandmother.
She leaves her cherished daughter, Joan and son-in-law, Bill Alfond, from Boston, Mass.; three loving grandchildren, State Senator Justin Alfond and his wife, Rachael, from Portland, Kenden Alfond and her husband, Charles Vincent, and great-granddaughter, Yaël Chava from Geneva, Switzerland, and Reis Alfond and his wife, Stefanie Alfond, of New York City.
Funeral services were held Thursday, Dec. 16, 2010, at Beth Israel Cemetery, Bangor.
In lieu of flowers, donations in her memory may be made to the Loring/Jacobson Scholarship, University of Maine Foundation, Two Alumni Place, Orono, Maine 04469- 5792, or to www.umainefoundation.org (a service of Brookings-Smith, Bangor).

description.hltext_display: Ni ma ca SMSCLUJ a fost de mare succes
description.author: piticu
description.content:
Unul din marile succese (zda masii cu indoctrinarea politica am scris de 3 ori succesuri _|_ ) ale Social Media Summit a fost ca Primarul Clujului a deschis gratios si impresionant conferinta.
Si nu s-a oprit aici. A aflat ca sunt bloggeri in Cluj, persoane influente, formatori de opinie, o gasca interesanta cu care trebuie sa se poarte corespunzator pentru ca asa i-a recomandat PR-ul.
Si i-a tratat pe bloggeri exact asa cum merita. Ca pe niste oameni de afaceri responsabili, ca pe investitorii de maine ai orasului. I-a chemat la un dineu unde toata lumea era la frac, mai putin bloggerii. Adica Groparu , dar nu e asta important. Daca inviti pe cineva la o chestie oficiala si vrei sa o faci misto, atunci ori ii recomanzi persoanei respective un cod de tinuta (asa cum fac americanii la toate tipurile de evenimente), ori te imbraci tu adecvat. Daca nu, vei fi tratat din start ca pe unul care nu vrea sa comunice cu nimeni, care a facut o aroganta sa invite niste bloggeri si sa nu ii bage in seama.
Iar cu domnii de au fost la eveniment se discuta mai cordial si mai prieteneste. Nu-mi inchipui sa-l vad pe Hadean sau Groparu sau Psaico stand si gesticuland cu rolexuri aurii la maini. No, dar bine ca ai fost in portocaliu, macar asa se respecta codul culorii.
Voi scrie si despre prezentarea de la Cluj.

description.hltext_display: Wool coins should show cruelty: PETA
description.content:
PETA says new coins commemorating the wool industry should be more realistic and include mulesing and live export images.
The Australian Mint is to release a special one dollar coin featuring a shearer hard at work and also a 20 cent coin depicting images from the history of wool production.
DO YOU AGREE?
Have Your Say in the form below
A statement from People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals said mulesing - a procedure in which skin was removed from a sheep's buttocks to prevent fly-strike - and live exports were shameful chapters in the wool industry's history.
"We can't pretend that they don't exist," the group's director of campaigns James Baker said in a statement.
"These atrocities should have been consigned to the pages of history books long ago, but until they are, people need to be aware that the Australian wool industry thrives on the horrific treatment of sheep."

event_or_fact.property: We can't pretend that they don't exist; These atrocities should have been consigned to the pages of history books long ago, but until they are, people need to be aware that the Australian wool industry thrives on the horrific treatment of sheep.

description.hltext_display: Phyllis Ann Berry
description.content:
LEWISTON Phyllis Ann Berry, 70, of Phillips, died Monday evening, Dec. 13, 2010 at the Central Maine Medical Center in Lewiston.
She was born in Augusta Nov. 29, 1940, the daughter of Raymond and Anita (Poulin) Merrill and attended Augusta schools.
She had worked at Lipmans Poultry, DeCoster Egg Farm, as a nurses aide in Idaho, at Livermore Falls Shoe and as a secretary for the Chamber of Commerce and UMF. Phyllis was a member of the American Legion Auxiliary in Phillips and enjoyed playing beano, crocheting and drawing.
She is survived by three sons, Boyd Mark Berry and his wife, Anne, of Whitefield, Benji Carroll Berry of Littleton, Col. and Charlie Dean Berry of Lewiston; two daughters, Tammy Ann Begin and her husband, Gary, of Wilton and Renee Marie Maddox of Littleton, Col.; brothers, Malcolm Merrill of Hollis Center and Bill Bailey of Avon; sisters, Merlene Bentley of Limington, Marsha Savage of Okla., Priscilla Higgins of Wilton, Sheila Jalbert of Phillips and Jeannine Rusgrove of Branford, Conn.; 16 grandchildren; and seven great-grandchildren.
She was predeceased by her parents; siblings, Dickie, Phillip and Paul Dutil and Sylvia Howe.
Words of condolence and tribute may be shared with her family at www.wilesrc.com.
Funeral services were held, Saturday, Dec. 18, 2010 at the First Apostolic Church in Wilton with Pastor Sharon Walston, officiating.
Spring interment will be at the Mile Square Cemetery in Avon. Arrangements are in the care of the Wiles Funeral Home, Cremation Service & Remembrance Center in Farmington.

description.hltext_display: EXTRA: Polis sköt man i Skellefteå
description.content:
Polisen sköt man i 40-årsåldern i nedre delen av kroppen. Mannens minderårige son fanns på platsen.
SKELLEFTEÅ. Ett flyktingdrama i Kåge slutade med att polisen sköt och träffade en man i 40-årsåldern.
Under natten mot onsdagen hade mannen låst in sig i sin bostad samtidigt som en polispatrull försökte nå honom.
Förhandlare och tolk fanns på plats - liksom mannens minderårige son.
Men förhandlingarna var fruktlösa. Och vid 06:30 på morgonen eskalerade situationen.
Mannen kom rusande ut mot polisen - som avlossade flera skott, uppger Västerbottens-Kuriren.
Enligt ett pressmeddelande från polisen rör det sig om en nödvärnssituation. Mannen träffades i underkroppen.
Mannens barn fanns då inte kvar på platsen.
Den skadade har förts till sjukhus och händelsen har, rutinmässigt, anmälts till riksenheten för polismål och ska utredas av åklagare.

description.hltext_display: Det går bra för Tyskland
description.content:
Lotta Lundberg författare, bosatt i Berlin Om natten så här års, när snoret fryser i näsan och vinte…
Lotta Lundberg
författare, bosatt i Berlin
Om natten så här års, när snoret fryser i näsan och vintern viner rå mellan husknutarna, flyttar hon in med sina påsar i bankomatrummet framför banken, det är varmt och ­kameraövervakat. Där sitter hon och muttrar sina obegripligheter. Jag hälsar alltid, det gör man i mina kvarter även om man inte känner varandra. Och hon blänger misstänksamt tillbaka. Och jag låtsas aldrig om att hela bankfoajén stinker av stickande urin. Försynt håller jag vanten om ­näsan när jag knappar in koden.
På tv rullar senaste reality-skitet. Tio socialbidragstagare får tjugo euro var av tevebolaget för att göra en middag enligt mottot: det går att ha trevligt med små medel. Den betygsätts, med avseende på hur smart de handlat, hur det smakar, dukning och allmän trivsel. Den som förlorar gråter och den som vinner gråter ännu högre, och alla kramas. Och programledaren talar om att julen tillägnas de svaga. Jag stänger av tv:n.
Och bestämmer mig för att ge alla som fryser och tigger en guldpeng. Efter en eftermiddag i rödkålsoset och julklappshetsen har jag delat ut nittio kronor. Nio gånger har jag sett in i de där skrämda vädjande ögonen. Det är ohållbart. Jag kan inte lämna bort en hundralapp var gång jag går utanför dörren. Hur ska jag förhålla mig?
Finansminister Schäuble säger att det går bra för Tyskland just nu för att det kapitalistiska systemet formar flexibla människor. Jag har fördomar och tänker att han som sitter i rullstol borde väl känna till vårt förakt för svaghet. Men en professor Heitmeyer i Bielefeld har forskat om just fördomar. Två­tusen tyskar har blivit uppringda en gång i månaden under nio år för att svara på frågor om de andras liv – de som man inte har så nära inpå att man kan säga att man känner varandra, men tillräckligt nära för att ha synpunkter på. Resultaten är förvånande. Rasismen har till exempel inte tilltagit. Det är alltid bra för Tyskland att kunna hänvisa till. Likaså backar de intervjuade vid sexistiska eller homofoba påståenden. Rädslan och aggressiviteten tilltar dock hos höginkomsttagarna. Och riktas mot handi­kappade, arbetslösa och hemlösa. Ju rikare desto rabiatare. Som om vi lyckats bli så politiskt korrekta att vi fattat vem vi kan ge oss på utan att få hela middagssällskapet över oss. Gärna en muslimsk eller lesbisk politiker men ve den som inte betalar sina egna räkningar. Det blir inga trevliga middagar.
På väg hem slår kylan rekord och jag går förbi bankomaten. Pisslukten har tilltagit med frosten. Hon är inte där, bara några påsar. För mig är det obegripligt att man inte slänger ut henne. Det måste alltså finnas en väktare som låter henne sitta där i snögruset och muttra. Någon som har fattat att medlidande är värdelöst utan barmhärtighet: handling.
Det är till den väktaren som den här krönikan är tillägnad.

description.hltext_display: Hattie McDaniel, une actrice exceptionnelle victime de sa (...)
description.content:
De Hattie McDaniel, tous les professionnels sont unanimes pour dire que cette afro-américaine née en 1895 était une actrice exceptionnellement douée. Mais, du fait de sa couleur, Hattie McDaniel se retrouva cantonnée dans des rôles de servante ; à ses consœurs telles que Carole Lombard, Vivien Leigh Marlene Dietrich, Mae West, etc. les rôles d’icônes glamour et objets de désir, car elles correspondaient plus à ce qu’Hollywood et la société voulaient promouvoir.
Comme le rappelle le site Associatedcontent.com, Hollywood avait salué sa performance, l’Académie et la presse savait déjà le nom de la gagnante, mais le soir du 29 février 1940, lors de la cérémonie des Oscars, Hattie McDaniel et ceux qui l’accompagnaient furent tout de même confinés à l’arrière de la salle. En ce temps là, Hollywood honorait certes la première actrice noire, mais le racisme ambiant ne tolérait pas qu’elle puisse être assise à côté de ses consœurs blanches. Face à ceux qui reprochent à Hattie McDaniel d’avoir accepté des rôles subalternes pérennisant les poncifs sur les Noirs, comment ne pas aussi voir qu’au vu de l’époque où elle vivait, l’actrice avait essayé de se battre avec ses moyens. Vaste débat qui rejoint la situation actuelle de moult acteurs noirs en France : jusqu’où doit-on aller pour accepter un rôle, et, a-t-on vraiment les moyens de dire non ? Vaste débat !
Mo’nique incarnera Hattie McDaniel dans un film sur la vie de la première actrice noire oscarisée
C’est l’actrice et productrice elle-même qui avait fait l’annonce ; oscarisée pour son rôle de mère indigne dans Precious, Mo’nique avait rendu un vibrant hommage à Hattie McDaniel, la première actrice noire ayant reçu la célèbre statuette, avouant au passage qu’elle allait incarner ladite actrice dans un biopic tiré de sa vie. ©Culturefemme.com
Retrouvez toute notre sélection Cinéma dans le numéro de décembre

description.hltext_display: Hamburger SV: Gelungener Hinrunden-Abschluss mit großen Problemen
description.content:
Die letzte Auswärtsfahrt der Bundesliga-Hinrunde und das letzte Pflichtspiel im Kalenderjahr 2010 verliefen für den Hamburger SV deutlich erfreulicher als die gesamte erste Saisonhälfte. Mit einem positiven Erfolgserlebnis verabschiedeten sich die HSV-Akteure in Richtung Weihnachtsurlaub. Zurück blieben viele offene Fragen, aber immerhin wurden auch schon einige Antworten gegeben.
Share Share
Hamburgs Elia lässt sich in Mönchengladbach feiern ()
Zum Thema
Hamburg. Das Kalenderjahr 2010 ist aus Hamburger Sicht endlich zu Ende. Keine allzu guten Erinnerungen wird der Hamburger SV an dieses Jahr haben, blickte man doch auf ein Europa League-Endspiel im eigenen Stadion und auf eine neue Saison, die mit viel Schwung beginnen sollte. Große Ziele, große Worte und keine großen Taten.
Weihnachts-Erfolgserlebnis in Gladbach
Zumindest der Abschluss des Kalenderjahres 2010 verlief nach Plan, dabei war die Anreise zum letzten Pflichtspiel des Jahres nicht unproblematisch. Das Schneechaos machte es den Hamburgern nicht leicht, nach Mönchengladbach zu reisen. Bei der Borussia spielten die HSV-Akteure 45 Minuten schlecht und 45 Minuten durchschnittlich. Gegen das Tabellenschlusslicht reichte diese Leistungssteigerung nach der Pause, um drei Punkte in die Weihnachtspause mitzunehmen.
Fragen und Antworten
Die Weihnachtsferien können also beginnen. Zurück blieben jedoch viele offene Fragen, aber immerhin wurden auch schon einige Antworten gegeben. Altstar Ze Roberto möchte beispielsweise, entgegen einiger Transfergerüchte, an der Elbe bleiben. „Ich habe die Spekulationen um meine Person mitbekommen und möchte deswegen ein klares Bekenntnis abgeben. Ich will meinen Vertrag beim HSV erfüllen. Ich werde am 2. Januar mit der Mannschaft ins Trainingslager nach Dubai reisen!“
Auch Ruud van Nistelrooy, mit 34 zwei Jahre jünger als Ze Roberto, möchte an der Elbe bleiben. „Normalerweise spiele ich bis Sommer hier. Davon gehe ich aus. Ich habe nichts anderes gehört“, erklärte der Stürmer gegenüber der Bild. Van Nistelrooy fasste auch die aktuelle Situation der Hanseaten treffend zusammen: „Ich bin gekommen - und der Erfolg ist ausgeblieben. Ich wollte den Verein weiterbringen. Das hat leider nicht geklappt. Der Verein ist ein schlafender Riese. Und auch ich habe es nicht geschafft, ihn aufzuwecken.“
Bleiben allerdings noch viele offene Fragen. Welche Spieler werden den Klub im Winter verlassen und auf welche neuen Gesichter darf man sich freuen? Bisher gibt es offenbar noch keine klaren Tendenzen. Dafür scheint es im Umfeld der Norddeutschen zu großen Bewegungen zu kommen. Das Personal-Karussell könnte sich offenbar sehr schnell ganz schnell drehen: Bilden Matthias Sammer und Michael Oenning die HSV-Zukunft? Was wird aus Coach Armin Veh? Und sitzt HSV-Boss Bernd Hoffmann auch weiterhin im Hamburger Boot? – Die ersten Antworten wird es wohl schon zum Jahresbeginn 2011 geben…
Eure Meinung: Was kann, muss und wird im Winter beim Hamburger SV passieren?

description.hltext_display: China aims to improve trade balance in 2011
description.content:
China will try to import more in 2011 while keeping exports steady, Commerce Minister Chen Deming said on Wednesday, in a sign that the world's second-largest economy is keen to pull more weight as a consumer.
In a statement on the ministry's website www.mofcom.gov.cn, Chen said China wants to better balance its trade account, and will step up purchases of high-tech goods and commodities such as grains and cotton next year.
"We will improve our policies and further simplify regulations to support expansions in imports and promote trade balance," Chen said.
Beijing, under foreign pressure to contribute to global economic rebalancing, has taken steps to spur domestic consumption to help reduce the economy's reliance on exports.
Keeping up the pressure on the euro zone to resolve its debt crisis, Chen said Europe's debt problems posed a serious risk to the recovery in the world economy, and that has helped to lead to "an extremely complicated" 2011 trade outlook for China.
Chen also warned of risks incurred by the sovereign debt crisis in the European countries and noted that they may undermine the foundation of world economic recovery.
"Sovereign debt issue and risks in the financial system are still far from being solved, the global economic growth may slow down," he added.
On Tuesday, China urged European officials to take urgent action to resolve simmering debt problems at annual trade talks with the European Union, its biggest trading partner.
Chen said China would also study how to diversify the use of its $2.65 trillion foreign exchange reserves, the world's largest.
China will use part of its foreign exchange reserves to support overseas ventures by domestic firms.
Chen also urged developed countries to remove restrictions on exports of high-tech products to China, which is seen by Beijing as one of the major reasons behind China's swelling trade surplus.
(Reporting by Zhou Xin, Aileen Wang and Koh Gui Qing; Editing by Alex Richardson)

event_or_fact.property: Europe's debt problems posed a serious risk to the recovery in the world economy, and that has helped to lead to "an extremely complicated" 2011 trade outlook for China

China would also study how to diversify the use of its $2.65 trillion foreign exchange reserves, the world's largest

description.hltext_display: Weniger Blutspender in der Region
description.content:
Einige DRK-Ortsvereine beklagen rückläufige Zahlen bei den Terminen. Viele wüssten nicht von den Vorteilen, so die Vorsitzenden. So könnten zum Beispiel Krankheiten erkannt werden.
Sind schon seit Jahren beim Blutspenden: (von links) Käthe Spieker, Leiterin des DRK-Blutspendedienstes Ostrhauderfehn, und die langjährigen Spender Alfred und Margarethe Bunger.
Bild: Leuchters
Oberledingerland - Die Zahl der Teilnehmer bei den regelmäßigen Blutspende-Terminen des Deutschen Roten Kreuzes (DRK) in der Region geht leicht zurück. Das berichten einige Ortsvereine aus dem Oberledingerland. "Vielen ist gar nicht klar, wie viele Menschen und Familien in Deutschland Blut benötigen", sagt Karl Peper, DRK-Ortsvorsitzender in Ostrhauderfehn. "Erst wenn die Menschen es in ihrer eigenen Familie erleben, dass jemand Blut braucht, dann wachen sie auf", sagt Annegret Schmidt-Bonhuis, Vorsitzende des DRK-Ortsvereins Collinghorst.
Ahlrich Heier, vom DRK-Ortsverein Rhauderfehn habe vor allem bemerkt, dass viele Ältere wegblieben, weil sie glaubten, dass sie im hohen Alter nicht mehr Blut spenden dürfen. "Dabei wurde die Altersgrenze vergangenes Jahr abgeschafft", so Heier. Jeder könne so lange spenden, wie es die Ärzte bei den Spende-Terminen zulassen. Die Eheleute Alfred und Margarethe Bunger aus Ostrhauderfehn spenden schon seit rund 45 Jahren regelmäßig. Insgesamt haben sie sich in ihrem gesamten Leben etwa 110 Liter Blut abnehmen lassen. "Wir fühlen uns dabei immer pudelwohl", sagt Alfred Bunger mit einem Lächeln.
Karl Peper betont, dass die Blutspende nicht ausschließlich für eine Person in Not lebensrettend sein kann. "Auch für jeden Spender ist sie wichtig", sagt er. Denn bei den Untersuchungen des Blutes können Krankheiten wie Hepatitis, Syphilis, HIV oder Lebererkrankungen nachgewiesen werden. Er nächste Blutspende-Termin ist am 28. Dezember in der Grundschule in der Middendorfstraße 9 in Ostrhauderfehn.
Mehr zu diesem Thema und weitere Blutspende-Termine lesen Sie Mittwoch, 22. Dezember, im General-Anzeiger.

description.hltext_display: Second half key for BA
description.content:
JANESVILLE — As Mitch Malecha nailed a 3-pointer at the buzzer to end the first half, the Bethlehem Academy boys basketball team was still in a bit of offensive disarray.
The Cardinals scored 13 points up to that point, missed several shots from within four feet of the basket and forced too many perimeter shots, according to coach Franz Boelter.
But the second half was a different story. BA outscored Janesville-Waldorf-Pemberton by 17 points in the final 18 minutes and came away with a 49-36 win in Janesville.
“Offensively we were a disaster in the first half,” Boelter said. “We played probably a little too much like individuals rather than as a unit.”
But Boelter said the Cardinals (2-2, 1-2 Gopher Conference) became cohesive offensively in the second half and also played standout defense and eliminated the Bulldogs’ penetration in the lane.
They forced JWP senior Connor Morton into foul trouble early, and despite scoring 10 points and snatching 11 rebounds the Bulldogs’ leading scorer was not a major factor late.
“It was a good stretch of basketball for us,” Boelter said. “That stretch in the second half was probably as well as we’ve played so far.”
BA GAME STATISTICS
BA 16 33 — 49
JWP 20 16 — 36
Scoring — Mitch Malecha 7, Kyle Filzen 8, Adam Clark 4, Kirk Allen 9, Sam Jensen 14, Tim Angell 2, Mike Beckmann 5. Assists (13) — Allen 6, Filzen 4. Rebounds (31) — Angell 7, Jensen 5, Clark 5, Beckmann 4. Steals (2) — Filzen 1, Jensen 1. 2FG — 14-43. 3FG — 5-13. FT — 16-23. TO — 17. Fouls — 16.

description.hltext_display: Rheinische Post: Goldenes Jahrzehnt Kommentar Von Birgit Marschall
description.content:
Bundeswirtschaftsminister so kurz vor Weihnachten besonders schöne
Wortgeschenke verteilen möchte. Doch Rainer Brüderle wiederholt nur,
was Fachleute schon lange für möglich halten: Deutschland könnte am
Beginn eines "Jahrzehnts der Arbeitnehmer" stehen. Vollbeschäftigung
ist keine Illusion mehr, sondern ein realistisches Szenario für das
Jahr 2015. Da qualifizierte Arbeitskräfte bei anhaltend guter
Konjunktur und sinkender Erwerbsbevölkerung knapp und knapper werden,
winken ihnen satte Einkommenssteigerungen. Schon wollen Großkonzerne
wie Bosch, Siemens oder Porsche Tariflohnerhöhungen, die erst im
April 2011 vorgesehen sind, um zwei Monate vorziehen. Steigende
Einkommen stützen den privaten Konsum - und der wiederum stimuliert
das Wachstum. Der Vorwurf, Deutschland lebe allein vom Export und
kaum von der Inlandsnachfrage, dürfte sich bald erübrigen. Allein das
Ausland könnte die schöne neue Zeit trüben. Ohne die gefährlich
schwelende Schulden- und Bankenkrise im Euro-Raum und die
Fragezeichen-Konjunktur in den USA stünde dem kleinen neuen
Wirtschaftswunder nichts mehr entgegen.
Originaltext: Rheinische Post
Digitale Pressemappe: http://www.presseportal.de/pm/30621

description.hltext_display: How Durable Are Teak Floors?
description.content:
Teak grows in a variety of colors.
Teak is is used for flooring because it is strong, durable and comes in a variety of colors from soft gold to a deep reddish-brown hue.
History
Teak trees can be found in South America.
Teak trees are native to areas of the south, as well as southeast Asia. It takes several decades for a teak tree to reach maturity and during this time it can grow to heights well over 100 feet. Due to the high demand for the wood, the species was depleted, but new teak plantations have been established to increase supply.
Teak wood is extremely hard which makes it a very durable flooring option. It can handle the demands of high traffic, families and pets.
The older the tree from which the teak wood is carved, the more durable the product. The older, slow-growth trees have natural oils that seal the inner layers. The end result is a flooring product that is almost impenetrable by water. However, due to the high demand for teak, younger trees are being harvested and kiln dried. Flooring from this product needs proper sealing to maintain its longevity.

description.hltext_display: 推廣歐洲旅遊 彎彎任特使
description.content:
（中央社記者謝佳珍台北22日電）台灣民眾赴歐免申根簽證明年1月11日起生效，為讓台灣民眾更了解歐洲，歐洲經貿辦事處邀請網路畫家彎彎擔任親善特使，歡迎大家前往歐洲旅遊。
彎彎應歐洲經貿辦事處邀請，6月造訪歐盟6國20天，回台灣後，將旅遊所見所聞以漫畫呈現，出版「歐洲GO了沒」遊記，今天舉辦新書發表會。
歐洲經貿辦事處長李篤以及比利時、匈牙利、波蘭、丹麥、德國等多國駐台代表都出席新書發表會，除在歐洲地圖貼上「GO」字樣，也齊跳方塊舞，象徵共同打開歐洲大門，歡迎台灣民眾赴歐旅遊。
彎彎表示，原以為歐洲遙不可及，這次受邀到歐洲旅遊學到很多東西，從倫敦到巴黎，免換貨幣，全使用歐元，歐洲無國界問題。
李篤除宣布台灣護照持有人明年1月11日起享有免簽進入歐盟，也歡迎台灣民眾前往觀光、商務考察。
歐洲聯盟今發布公報，正式宣布台灣取得歐盟免簽證待遇，待法定公告時間20天期滿後生效。991222

description.hltext_display: 體現兩岸特色？小英：自我矮化
description.content:
（中央社記者溫貴香台北22日電）民主進步黨主席蔡英文今天表示，投保協議的共識文字，出現「體現兩岸特色」的文字太輕率，等於是自動放棄國際規範的保護傘，也是自我矮化。
蔡英文下午在中常會致詞表示，第6次江陳會有關投資保障協議（簡稱投保協議）不但沒有簽署，且根據21日公布的「階段性共識」看來，未來投保協議的討論，是依中國設定的的方向進行。
蔡英文表示，投保協議的共識文字，出現「體現兩岸特色」。民進黨提醒，與中國交往的最佳途徑，是「從世界走向中國」；台灣不應該輕率地在兩會共識中，接受「兩岸特色」這樣的文字，這等於是自動放棄國際規範的保護傘，也是自我矮化。
她表示，民進黨要求立法院要實質審查與中國簽署的所有協議，協議授權下的工作進行，包括ECFA（經濟合作架構協議）下的「經合會（經濟合作委員會）」、衛生醫藥合作協議下的「工作組」，未來的決議與方案都應送國會審查，以避免空白授權剝奪了政府公權力。
另外，對於八德國中校園霸凌一事，蔡英文說，這顯示會報與通報機制停擺、崩解，整個體系螺絲鬆掉。她說，除了各級首長應負責外，要先對症下藥，就是「建立校園專業輔導體系，設置專業專職的輔導教師」。991222

description.hltext_display: Acidente entre caminhão e carreta bloqueia a ERS 122 em Farroupilha
description.content:
Choque entre veículos causou apenas danos materiais
Um acidente entre um caminhão e uma carreta bloqueia parcialmente a ERS 122, em Farroupilha, na manhã desta quarta-feira. De acordo com o Comando Rodoviário da Brigada Militar (CRBM), a colisão ocorreu no km 45, no distrito de Sete Colônias, próximo à Curva da Morte. O CRBM informou que somente uma das faixas está livre e o trânsito é lento no local. O choque causou apenas danos materiais.

description.hltext_display: Samsungs Enterprise-SSDs mit MLC-Speicher
description.content:
Auch für den Enterprise-Sektor werden in jüngster Zeit verstärkt Solid State Drives mit (e)MLC- statt SLC-Speicherchips vorgestellt. Diesem Trend schließt sich nun auch Samsung an. Das Unternehmen liefert erste Testmuster neuer 2,5-Zoll-Laufwerke mit 100, 200 und 400 GB Speicherkapazität auf Basis von MLC-Speicher aus.
Die neuen Laufwerke mit Verschlüsselung seien jedoch kein Ersatz für schnelle SLC-Laufwerke, wie sie auch Samsung selbst erst im Oktober oder jüngst Toshiba wieder vorstellten, sondern sollen das Angebot vielmehr um Modelle mit hoher Speicherdichte ergänzen, die als primäres Speichermedium an Stelle von Festplatten eingesetzt werden können. Die MLC-Speicherchips mit Toggle-DDR-Interface werden in einem Prozess der 30-nm-Klasse hergestellt und hängen an einem Controller der nach außen mit SATA 3 Gbit/s kommuniziert.
Hinsichtlich der zu erwartenden Leistung spricht Samsung von 43.000 IOPS bei Random Reads und 11.000 IOPS bei Random Writes und vergleicht dies mit einer SAS-HDD, die mit 15.000 U/min arbeitet und beim Lesen und Schreiben 350 IOPS erreicht. Den Beginn der Massenfertigung der neuen Enterprise-Laufwerke hat Samsung für den kommenden Monat vorgesehen.

description.hltext_display: The Best Way to Get Rid of Roaches Permanently
description.content:
Don't give roaches a reason to think your home is attractive.
Cockroaches are resilient insects. There are five different roach species on the North American continent; each has its preferred environment, foods and distinct behavioral patterns. One of the main considerations when it comes to the extermination of roaches is knowing the type of species with which you are dealing and knowing where in a building they have colonized. Use a roach trap, like the "sticky" traps used for mice, to catch and determine the roach species that is in your home.
Difficulty: Moderately Challenging
Instructions
Things You'll Need:
Caulk
Caulking gun
Boric acid
Vacuum cleaner
Roach spray
Food-grade diatomaceous earth
1
Find American cockroaches in moist, warm places. One of the largest North American roach species, the American cockroach loves humidity. They are often found in bathrooms and basements, and the best way to get rid of them is to cut off their access to your home and decrease the humidity within the home with a dehumidifier. Use caulk to fill in any cracks that are 1/4 inch in size or larger, inside or outside of a home. Pay special attention to areas such as the foundation, baseboards and walls. Dust boric acid in areas that have heavy "roach traffic." Boric acid kills roaches by paralyzing them after it is ingested or absorbed into their skin. After exposure to boric acid, a roach eventually starves to death.
Look for German cockroaches in warm areas of a building, like heating vents and furnaces. This type of roach thrives in most environments, but prefers those that are hot. Seal any open areas of the home, such as baseboards and walls, with caulking material. Vacuum the home and vacuum the heating vents and around furnaces. If you know where the high-traffic roach areas of the home are, sprinkle boric acid in those places. If not, place roach baits that contain boric acid in the high traffic areas you suspect.
Look for brown stripes on a cockroach's back to identify a brown-banded cockroach. These pests like warm, dry climates such as attics and the second floor of a home. Brown-banded roaches like to eat clothes, glue, fabric and items containing starch. As a result, you may find groups of these roaches living in closets and shelves. Brown-banded roaches, if they are eating your clothes and fabric, leave clues: small holes in the material and brownish spots, which are their excrement. One of the easiest ways to find their home within yours is to leave the lights off in a room at night, turn the lights on and notice where the roaches run to hide. Remove all the clothes from a closet, wash them and spray the hiding spots with a roach spray that has a pyrethrin or permethrin base. Then, vacuum the home and use an attachment to vacuum the corners of closets so you can get rid of the roach eggs. Caulk cracks around cabinets, shelves and under baseboards before dusting the areas where the brown-banded roaches made their home.
Find Oriental cockroaches feeding off your garbage. One of the darkest roaches and larger North American species, the Oriental cockroach thrives in cool, wet, decaying environments, like garbage cans. These roaches are known to spread food-borne illnesses because they like to eat rotten food. You may find these roaches in drains, basements, cellars and refrigerators. Keeping your home dry and warm is a good way to get rid of Oriental cockroaches. Place a dehumidifier in your basement or on the first floor of your home and dust the area with boric acid. Take your trash out on a regular basis, do not leave food or compost in or near your home and make sure all garbage cans have a lid.
Look for the smoky brown cockroach around fruits and vegetables. Smoky brown cockroaches are brown in color and have a reddish lower end. They are vegetarians that usually live outside, but this roach will make a home wherever they find rotting fruits and vegetables, such as kitchens, greenhouses and gardens. Along with sealing cracks around the home, clean your doorway, the edges of the building and windowsills. Then, line the perimeter of your home with diatomaceous earth (dirt) that is organic, food grade and desiccant-like. Diatomaceous earth contains particles that eat away at a roach's exoskeleton, causing it do die of dehydration within 48 hours of exposure to the product.

description.hltext_display: Rheinische Post: Löhrmanns Erfolg Kommentar Von Frank Vollmer
description.content:
NRW-Schulministerin Sylvia Löhrmann erhofft haben: Mindestens 19
Kommunen werden eine Gemeinschaftsschule beantragen. Löhrmanns
Prestige-Projekt ist vor allem auf dem Lande attraktiv - von dort
kommt die Mehrheit der Anträge. Den Kommunen, denen die Schüler
fehlen, kommt die neue Schule mit ihrem Weg zum Abitur wie gerufen.
Die Sorge um den Schulstandort ist größer als die Angst, die
Gemeinschaftsschule werde Gymnasien dahinraffen. Andererseits, und
auch das ist gut für Löhrmann, bleibt das Interesse überschaubar.
Stünden die Kommunen gleich im halben Hundert auf der Matte, müsste
die Ministerin nämlich Abschied nehmen von ihrer (ohnehin heftig
umstrittenen) Konstruktion, die Gemeinschaftsschule per Schulversuch,
also am Landtag vorbei, einzuführen. Eine parlamentarische Mehrheit
dafür ist aber derzeit nicht in Sicht. Löhrmanns Gegner geraten jetzt
unter Zugzwang, allen voran die CDU. Sie hat gerade erst ein
umständliches Modell präsentiert, das ein Gegenentwurf zur
Gemeinschaftsschule sein soll. Als Schreckgespenst wird die aber
offenbar auch in Kommunen mit christdemokratischer Mehrheit nicht
empfunden. Die CDU hat noch viel Diskussionsbedarf.
Originaltext: Rheinische Post
